required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Association Between Delivered Oxygen and Cerebral Impact During the Use of Cardiopulmonary Bypass.
clinical_study.official_title: The Association Between Delivered Oxygen and Cerebral Impact During the Use of Cardiopulmonary Bypass.

brief_summary.textblock: Investigating the connection between delivered oxygen index and cerebral impact with COx (cerebral oximetry index) och cerebral injury markers during the routine use of cardiopulmonary bypass.

detailed_description.textblock:
The research subjects are to be treated with CPB with according to local standards (perfusion index 2.4 x body surface area). While measuring impact on cerebral autoregulation with the aid of Near InfraRed Spectroscopy (NIRS) and brain injury markers in blood, research subjects depending on initial hemoglobin value, will divide into two subgroups: one with DO2I of >280 ml/min/m2, and one with DO2I of <280 ml/min/m2.
DO2I will during CPB be calculated using the patient data monitoring system Metavision.
With a correlation analysis between NIRS and MAP (mean arterial pressure) a COx (Cerebral Oxymetry Index) r-value can indicate impact on cerebral autoregulation with values >0.3 - 0.5 during use of CPB 4.
Brain injury markers (Tau, Glial Fibrillary Acidic Protein (GFAP), Neurospecific Enolase (NSE)) are collected during 5 occasions during the first 24 hours and then once per day for 4 days, as well as markers for AKI (S-Creatinine) in some extent.
Registrations during the intensive care regarding delirium, stroke or other neurological impact will also be included in the study.

primary_outcome.description: COx (Cerebral Oximetry Index; correlation between rSO2 values (INVOS) and mean artery pressure) that indicated impact on cerebral autoregulation on DO2 index values below set limits of 280 ml/m2/min.

primary_outcome.measure: Brain injury markers; tau, GFAP, NSE
primary_outcome.description: Brain injury markers that indicate cerebral neuronal damage on DO2 index values below set limits of 280 ml/m2/min.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group with DO2i <280 ml/min/m2 during cardiopulmonary bypass
Group with DO2i >280 ml/min/m2 during cardiopulmonary bypass

intervention.description: Blood tests at given time points perioperatively.

intervention.description: Cerebral oximetry index measurements with the aid of Near Infrared Spectroscopy
intervention.arm_group_label: Group with DO2i <280 ml/min/m2 during cardiopulmonary bypass
Group with DO2i >280 ml/min/m2 during cardiopulmonary bypass

biospec_descr.textblock: Cerebral injury markers in blood plasma

study_pop.textblock: 120 research subjects scheduled for coronary arterial bypass grafting surgery and/or aortic valve replacement in Uppsala University Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for CABG and/or AVR
Exclusion Criteria:
- Former diagnosed neurological insults, carotid stenosis
